UseCaseTitle: Agentic AI for Tier-1 Telecom Customer Support
Purpose: To automate issue diagnosis, sentiment monitoring, and intelligent escalation within telecom customer service, reducing resolution time and enhancing CX through a multi-agent architecture.
ExecSummary: Telecom operators face mounting pressure to improve customer experience while minimizing operational costs. Traditional IVRs and human-dependent resolution models are inefficient and non-scalable. This solution leverages Agentic AI to orchestrate autonomous resolution flows using contextual memory and dynamic state machines.
BusinessObjectives: Reduce Average Handling Time (AHT) and First Contact Resolution (FCR) failures
Enable intelligent, autonomous troubleshooting of technical issues
Minimize need for human agents for low-to-medium complexity problems
Improve CSAT and NPS scores via faster response and proactive issue handling
BusinessBenefits: Real-time escalation based on sentiment tracking
Reduced dependency on manual L1/L2 support
overview: This demo showcases an end-to-end Agentic AI framework that autonomously handles complex enterprise tasks using multi-agent systems with contextual memory and dynamic decision graphs. It reflects a production-grade architecture for intelligent telecom support.
business: The demo targets Tier-1 telecom customer support, reducing average resolution time by 60%, enhancing customer satisfaction, and enabling real-time sentiment tracking and intelligent escalation, all without human intervention.
approach: The solution leverages LangGraph for orchestrating agent workflows, Faiss for semantic search via RAG, and Neo4j for contextual knowledge graph storage. Each agent interacts indirectly through contextual memory, ensuring modularity and traceability.
BusinessDrivers: Reduce support costs through intelligent automation
Improve customer retention by resolving issues on first contact
Enable proactive engagement via real-time sentiment analysis
Ensure consistent support across digital channels
Scale operations without increasing human headcount
BusinessChallanges: High churn due to unresolved technical issues
Manual triaging increases MTTR (Mean Time to Resolve)
Poor visibility into customer frustration during calls
Inability to scale support during peak outage events
FunctionalOverview: Intent Detection: Identifies customer need (e.g., billing, technical issue, escalation)
Automated Troubleshooting: Uses dynamic decision trees and semantic search to resolve issues
Sentiment Monitoring: Analyzes user sentiment mid-conversation
Smart Escalation: Escalates cases based on emotion or unresolved status
Contextual Memory: Retains session history for stateful conversation

FunctionalComponentDetails.Description: Identifies customer intent from queries to route them to appropriate agents or workflows.
KeyFeatures: Customizable intents for different telecom domains
BusinessImpact: Enables faster triage and resolution flows

FunctionalComponentDetails.Description: Diagnoses technical issues using semantic search and state-driven dialogue trees.
Triggers human-in-the-loop escalations based on sentiment, unresolved issues, or policy violations.
KeyFeatures: Sentiment score tracking in real time

FunctionalComponentDetails.Description: Monitors and manages agent workflows, failures, and escalations.

SolutionOverview: Multi-agent system with loosely coupled execution via LangGraph
Semantic search using Faiss-based RAG for resolution matching
Contextual memory for session continuity and knowledge sharing
Neo4j-based Knowledge Graph for structured domain knowledge
Designed for telecom IVRs, web, and WhatsApp channels
dataflow: User queries flow into the Intent Detection Agent, which determines the required response or escalation. Data is enriched via the contextual memory, using Faiss for RAG and Neo4j for past resolutions. Agents collaboratively process and update the memory before responding.
design: Each agent follows a state-based execution triggered by events using LangGraph. They are containerized for scalability and interact with tools (e.g., vector DB, KG, APIs) indirectly. Failures are tracked using a supervisor agent with fallback mechanisms.

cost.CAPEX: 50,000 - covers initial design, development, and cloud infra provisioning
cost.OPEX: 5,000/month - includes GPU inference, storage, monitoring, and support
